comments: A073591(n) is an upper bound on a(n).If the edges of a complete graph with at least as many nodes as a(n) are colored with n colors then there is always a monochromatic triangle.
references: G. Berman and K. D. Fryer, Introduction to Combinatorics. Academic Press, NY, 1972, p. 175.
R. E. Greenwood and A. M. Gleason, Combinatorial relations and chromatic graphs, Canad. J. Math., 7 (1955), 1-7.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
example: a(2)=6 since in a party with at least 6 people, there are three people mutually acquainted or three people mutually unacquainted.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Upper bound and additional comments from D. G. Rogers (drogers(AT)turing.une.edu.au), Aug 27 2006
Better definition from Max Alekseyev, Jan 12 2008
